instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, small water damage around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> bios chip, now cant boot fully
threads.message: So <CAPACITOR>C6100</CAPACITOR> was corroded and kinda fell off the board, that is around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, the board doesnt look bad, always starts up with chima, it will start to boot, and the line under the apple logo just about to finish, than it powers off, in boot menu holding option key is the same, new battery and new SSD with installed osx,s still the same. Now i think it will be the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> bios chip, we have 2 donor boards, one of them have a good loking <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, but atm i dont have the programmer, do i start that way? to remove <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, read it out and program the bios chip, or if the bios chip is damaged it would not even try to boot?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, small water damage around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> bios chip, now cant boot fully
threads.message: It powers off in the boot menu too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, small water damage around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> bios chip, now cant boot fully
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, small water damage around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> bios chip, now cant boot fully
threads.message: It's not the chip. Check all traces and termination resistors (16 of them). Also inspect <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> for corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, small water damage around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> bios chip, now cant boot fully
threads.message: 16? in the schamtics on the 45. page , SPI Bus Series Termination, is see like 14 of them, but some of them are not installed, even on the 2 donor boards i have, like <RESISTOR>R6130</RESISTOR> is not present on any board i have , nor <RESISTOR>R6131</RESISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, small water damage around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> bios chip, now cant boot fully
threads.message: i checked aroun <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, looks pretty good, no corrosion, now i found another capacitor, it was corroded and broke off easily, <CAPACITOR>C1801</CAPACITOR>, that is filtering the <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, small water damage around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> bios chip, now cant boot fully
threads.message: i took off the bios chip to see corrosion, but that is fine, i put it back, same thing, than SMC reset, works, charger light changes to green, but PRAM reset wont work, maybe it does not  have time to finish, same with usb keyboard, and now after tryin pram reset a few times there is only backliht and chime, but no apple logo, now i cant even go into the boot menu, i powers off in about 10 sec

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, small water damage around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> bios chip, now cant boot fully
threads.message: i resoldered all the resistors around the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, measured them, they are ok, and the tracks are not broken

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, small water damage around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> bios chip, now cant boot fully
threads.message: Is the power button not bad and shorting out? Check <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> for 3V42, disconnect internal keyboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, small water damage around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> bios chip, now cant boot fully
threads.message: i tried it with everything disconnected but the lcd, battery, doing the same, even without the SSD or with another ssd, , after the battery was removed and plugged in again with the charger the board will start up by itself once which is normal, i dunno maybe i will keep it for a little while, and than close it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, small water damage around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> bios chip, now cant boot fully
